question_text: A technician wants to use a legacy Molex connector on a drive designed for SATA power. What issue might occur?
answer_options: Molex provides only 3.3V, which SATA drives require
The Molex connector has a different pin shape and voltage profile
SATA drives use analog signaling that Molex doesnâ€™t support
Molex cannot provide enough bandwidth for modern drives
correct_answer: The Molex connector has a different pin shape and voltage profile
explanation: Molex and SATA power connectors deliver different voltages and pinouts. Adapters are required and may not support all features like hot-swap or 3.3V.
